metadata.description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Hydrocodone (Vicodin).

content:
Drug: Hydrocodone | cid: 5284569
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Hydrocodone (Vicodin).
Erowid name: hydrocodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    Thinning Out Your Physical Library?

If you have books or periodicals about drugs, contribute them to Erowid! Your old books will find a good home in our library or for a supporter. [details]

* Every individual reacts differently to every substance. * Be mindful at every step. * Know your body.  Know your mind.  Know your source.


                    Context: 
                    This section appears on Erowid’s hydrocodone information page, following navigation menus and before detailed safety information about hydrocodone. It features a call for book donations to the Erowid library, followed by general harm reduction advice reminding users that individual reactions to substances differ and encouraging mindfulness and self-awareness.

metadata.title: Erowid Hydrocodone (Vicodin) Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Hydrocodone (Vicodin).

content:
Drug: Hydrocodone | cid: 5284569
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Hydrocodone (Vicodin).
Erowid name: hydrocodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    At high doses or in sensitive patients, hydrocodone may produce dose-related respiratory depression by acting directly on the brain stem respiratory center. Hydrocodone also affects the center that controls respiratory rhythm, and may produce irregular and periodic breathing. The respiratory depressant effects of narcotics and their capacity to elevate cerebrospinal fluid pressure may be markedly exaggerated in the presence of head injury, other intracranial lesions or a preexisting increase in intracranial pressure. Furthermore, narcotics produce adverse reactions which may obscure the clinical course of patients with head injuries. The administration of narcotics may obscure the diagnosis or clinical course of patients with acute abdominal conditions. Be careful when combining hydrocodone with other CNS depressants such as alcohol, narcotics, antihistamines, antipsychotics, and anti-anxiety agents. The use of MAO inhibitors or tricyclic antidepressants with hydrocodone preparations


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is from an Erowid informational page about hydrocodone, located within the Pharmaceuticals section. It specifically describes the risks and interactions associated with hydrocodone use, emphasizing respiratory depression, dangers for patients with head injuries or certain medical conditions, and interactions with CNS depressants and antidepressants.

metadata.title: Erowid Hydrocodone (Vicodin) Vault : Health
metadata.description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Hydrocodone (Vicodin).

content:
Drug: Hydrocodone | cid: 5284569
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on health affects and concerns related to Hydrocodone (Vicodin).
Erowid name: hydrocodone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Health

                    Text: 
                    with other CNS depressants such as alcohol, narcotics, antihistamines, antipsychotics, and anti-anxiety agents. The use of MAO inhibitors or tricyclic antidepressants with hydrocodone preparations may increase the effect of either the antidepressant or hydrocodone.


                    Context: 
                    This chunk is from a section discussing the risks and interactions of hydrocodone, specifically warning about the heightened dangers when combined with other central nervous system (CNS) depressants like alcohol, other narcotics, antihistamines, antipsychotics, anti-anxiety agents, MAO inhibitors, or tricyclic antidepressants, as these combinations can amplify the effects and potential adverse reactions of hydrocodone.
